page.title: 02FARMING 1
page.content: INTRODUCTION On Friday 12 July 1985 the farming section of this project visited the area to be surveyed.We decided not to use the questionnaire but to base our report on observation.A very good view of the farmland was obtained both from Ingra Tor and Sharpitor.Fields in the lower part of the Walkham Valley were cultivated for market produce far more than fields further up the valley which changed from grassland to moorland with increasing height. LIVESTOCK Predominantly sheep.The type of sheep was mainly"upland".The sheep were sometimes in the same field as bullocks and some sheep were grazed on common land with sheep owned by other farmers,Eg.Huckworthy Common.The identifying markings were mainly coloured red.
